byline.contributor: Wai Moe reported from Yangon, and Austin Ramzy from Hong Kong.
byline.original: By WAI MOE and AUSTIN RAMZY

abstract: U Aung Thaung, Burmese politician and businessman accused of corruption and directing violence against dissidents, dies at age 74.
lead_paragraph: He was the industry minister from 1997 to 2011, a position that he was said to have manipulated to financially benefit himself, his family and aides.

headline.main: U Aung Thaung, Burmese Politician Accused of Abuses, Dies at 74
headline.print_headline: U Aung Thaung, a Burmese Politician, Dies at 74

snippet: He was the industry minister from 1997 to 2011, a position that he was said to have manipulated to financially benefit himself, his family and aides.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
